section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these Rules, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: associate (有聯繫者), in relation to an individual, means the spouse or any child of the individual;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a corporation the principal business of which is to act as a custodian of securities or other property for another person, whether on trust or by contract; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following persons whose business includes acting as a custodian of securities or other property for another person, whether on trust or by contract— (L.N. 99 of 2018)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a bank which is not an authorized financial institution but is regulated under the law of any place outside Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a person carrying on the business of the provision of investment services and regulated under the law of any place outside Hong Kong; (L.N. 99 of 2018)

def.name: Portfolio
def.leadIn: portfolio (投資組合) means a portfolio comprising any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: securities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate of deposit issued by—

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a bank which is not an authorized financial institution but is regulated under the law of any place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to an individual, corporation or partnership, money held by a custodian for the individual, corporation or partnership;

def.name: PublicFiling
def.leadIn: public filing (公開檔案) means a document that, pursuant to the legal or regulatory requirements in Hong Kong or in a place outside Hong Kong, has been submitted to a person or body that is under a duty to publish the document to, or otherwise make the document available for inspection by, members of the public in Hong Kong or in a place outside Hong Kong, by or on behalf of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a trust corporation (whether on its own behalf or in respect of a trust of which it acts as a trustee);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a corporation (other than a trust corporation referred to in paragraph (a)); or

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a partnership; (L.N. 99 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an advertisement, invitation or document described in section 103(3)(k) of the Ordinance, means the date on which the advertisement, invitation or document is issued, or possessed for the purposes of issue;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a call described in section 174(2)(a) of the Ordinance, means the date on which the call is made;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of an offer described in section 175(5)(d) of the Ordinance, means the date on which the offer is made; or

paragraph.name: d
a
paragraph.content: any trust company registered under Part 8 of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29); or

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: carries on a business which is of a nature similar to that of a trust company referred to in paragraph (a); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is regulated under the law of any place outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Amount in Hong Kong dollars includes its equivalent in any foreign currency
section.leadIn: In these Rules, a reference to an amount expressed in Hong Kong dollars includes its equivalent in any foreign currency.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Persons prescribed as professional investors
section.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph (j) of the definition of professional investor in section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Ordinance, the following persons are prescribed as within the meaning of that definition for the purposes of any provision of the Ordinance other than Schedule 5— (L.N. 99 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a trust corporation specified in section 4;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an individual specified in section 5(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a corporation (other than a trust corporation referred to in paragraph (a)) specified in section 6;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a partnership specified in section 7. (L.N. 99 of 2018)

section.name: s4
section.heading: Trust corporations
section.leadIn: A trust corporation specified for the purposes of section 3(a) is a trust corporation having been entrusted under one or more trusts of which it acts as a trustee with total assets of not less than $40 million at the relevant date or as ascertained in accordance with section 8.

subsection.content: An individual specified for the purposes of section 3(b) is an individual having a portfolio of not less than $8 million at the relevant date or as ascertained in accordance with section 8, when any one or more of the following are taken into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a portfolio on the individual’s own account;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a portfolio on a joint account with the individual’s associate;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the individual’s share of a portfolio on a joint account with one or more persons other than the individual’s associate;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a portfolio of a corporation which, at the relevant date, has as its principal business the holding of investments and is wholly owned by the individual.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(c), an individual’s share of a portfolio on a joint account with one or more persons other than the individual’s associate is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the individual’s share of the portfolio as specified in a written agreement among the account holders; or

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the absence of an agreement referred to in paragraph (a), an equal share of the portfolio.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Corporations
section.leadIn: A corporation specified for the purposes of section 3(c) is—

paragraph.name: a

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: a portfolio of not less than $8 million; or

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: total assets of not less than $40 million,

paragraph.leadIn: at the relevant date or as ascertained in accordance with section 8;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a corporation which, at the relevant date, has as its principal business the holding of investments and is wholly owned by any one or more of the following persons—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: a trust corporation specified in section 4;

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: a corporation specified in this paragraph or paragraph (a);

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: a professional investor within the meaning of paragraph (a), (d), (e), (f), (g) or (h) of the definition of professional investor in section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a corporation which, at the relevant date, wholly owns a corporation referred to in paragraph (a).

section.name: s7
section.heading: Partnerships
section.leadIn: A partnership specified for the purposes of section 3(d) is a partnership having—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a portfolio of not less than $8 million; or

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: total assets of not less than $40 million,

section.leadIn: at the relevant date or as ascertained in accordance with section 8.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Ascertaining total assets or portfolio
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 4, 5(1), 6(a) or 7, the total assets entrusted to a trust corporation, the portfolio of an individual, or the portfolio or total assets of a corporation or partnership, are to be ascertained by referring to any one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a trust corporation, corporation or partnership, the most recent audited financial statement prepared within 16 months before the relevant date in respect of the trust corporation (or a trust of which it acts as a trustee), corporation or partnership;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a trust corporation, individual, corporation or partnership, any one or more of the following documents issued or submitted within 12 months before the relevant date—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: a statement of account or a certificate issued by a custodian;

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: a certificate issued by an auditor or a certified public accountant;

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: a public filing submitted by or on behalf of the trust corporation (whether on its own behalf or in respect of a trust of which it acts as a trustee), individual, corporation or partnership.
